intro: Tetraria crassa, commonly known as the common tetraria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or brown in color. The plant produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize a variety of habitats. Tetraria crassa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of certain ecological systems.
